br.eti.rslemos.bitsmagic

Class Shifter

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.eti.rslemos.bitsmagic.Shifter

  • public class Shifter
extends Object
    This class consists exclusively of static methods that implement a barrel shifter over arrays of integral primitive types.

    For every method available in this class, the arguments that represent offsets should always be given in bits, and are 0-based. For more information about bit mapping in arrays of integral primitive types see Store class.

    The operations implemented in this class try to mimic Java shift operators: the shift amount is always taken modulo shift region width.

    Offlimits bits are hardwired to 0: when shifted in they appear as 0; when shifted out they are simply discarded. Methods in this class should never throw ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

    NullPointerException is thrown if the given array is null.

    All methods are inherently thread unsafe: in case of more than one thread acting upon the same storage the results are undefined. Also neither they acquire nor block on any monitor. Any necessary synchronization should be done externally.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rodrigo Lemos
    See Also:
    Store

    • Method Detail

      • shr

        public static void shr(byte[] data,
                       int from,
                       int to,
                       int amount)
        Shifts to the right (towards LSB) the specified region of the given storage by the specified amount. The range considered extends from offset from, inclusive, to offset to, exclusive. If to <= from the storage is left unchanged. The amount is taken modulo to - from. If amount is negative, it is added to - from until positive. The real amount of bits shifted will be between 0, inclusive, and to - from, exclusive. If the real amount of bits shifted is 0, the storage is left unchanged. The shifted in bits to the left (on MSB) are hardwired to 0.
        Parameters:
        data - storage array.
        from - offset, in bits, 0-based, of the first bit (inclusive) to be shifted to the right.
        to - offset, in bits, 0-based, of the last bit (exclusive) to be shifted to the right.
        amount - number of bits to shift to right. This number is taken modulo to - from. If negative, it is added to - from until positive.
        Since:
        1.0.0
